ygData.subject: RE: Reduced Taunt?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm, if I understand you correctly you are saying that: If the song has a radius of X and the mob has a radius of Y then I can/will aggro the mob if I am
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm, if I understand you correctly you are saying
that:

If the song has a radius of X and the mob has a radius
of Y then I can/will aggro the mob if I am closer than
X + Y?

I had always assumed that I was safe if I stood
outside of the radius of whichever was largest.

Tomerrilin

--- "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
wrote:
> Yes but don't ya think increasing the radius of
> Selo's might increase the
> radius at which it agros mobs as well? That could
> be why even though you
> were far enough away, it no longer was far enough
> due to the increased Selo
> radius.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Peck White [mailto:peck_white@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 1:34 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Reduced Taunt?
>
>
> From: Peck White <peck_white@...>
>
> On a similar note,
>
> Last night I was in NK on my way to Halas. I was at
> the wooden bridge when a druid came running down the
> road being chased by Grimfeather, a kite gone bad I
> think. I ran up the shore to the north to stay out
> of
> Grim's aggro radius. I also fired up Selo's "just
> in
> case". As soon as the druid zoned Grim came
> straight
> at me. Not up the road and then turning toward me,
> but in a straight beeline. To make a long story
> short, I went from full health to dead before I
> could
> zone. I was never closer than 150 yds to him before
> he attacked. I'm sure glad the Taunt has been
> reduced.
>
> Tomerrilin
> Bard of the 22nd, 23rd, 22nd song
> Mith Marr
>
> --- "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> wrote:
> > Hmmm, that is awfully similar to my near death
> last
> > nite. A Paladin and his
>
